org.flexiblepower.observation

Class Observation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flexiblepower.observation.Observation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the value that is stored in the Observation.

    public class Observation<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An Observation is a measurement that has been done at a certain time. It is a tuple with the observedAt date and the value (of dynamic type). This class provides a couple of helpful methods, like getting the value as a Map when you don't know the type (see getValueMap(). For the helper methods, it is assumed that the value is a Java bean with getters.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <T> Observation<T> create(java.util.Date observedAt,
                        T value)
        Creates a new Observation for the given tuple. This static helper method removes the need for specifying T explicitly in java. This is exactly the same as calling new Observation<T>(observedAt, value).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value that is stored in the Observation.
        Parameters:
        observedAt - The date at which the value has been observed.
        value - The value
        Returns:
        The newly created Observation object.

      • getObservedAt

        public java.util.Date getObservedAt()
        Returns:
        The date at which the value has been observed.

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Returns:
        The value

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.String name)
        Tries to find a part of the value with the given name. It will assume a Java bean with getter methods. This is equal to calling getValueMap().get(name). Note: this is heavily dependent on reflection and therefore won't work on embedded Java versions.
        Parameters:
        name - The name that will be used to find the getter method.
        Returns:
        The object when such a value has been found, null otherwise.

      • getValueMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getValueMap()
        Detects all the parts of the value, assuming a Java bean. This will detect all getter methods and return the corresponding sub-values.
        Returns:
        A Map with all the sub-values.
